intro: Sphenostylis kerstingii, commonly known as the African tamarind, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces pods containing edible seeds that are often used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Its roots are also valued for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial effects. Sphenostylis kerstingii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
